Li MAS NMR was used to probe the Li dynamics in LLZT and H-LLZT.
resonance around 0 ppm, and the smaller line width at half-maximum
height (280 Hz) in LLZT indicates a higher Li-ion mobility in LLZT than
that in H-LLZT (700 Hz). The two-component NMR line was represented
by a composite of a broad (Gaussian) and a narrow(Lorentzian) compo-
nent, which can be assigned to
Li populations with higher and lower ion
fast Li ions in LLZT and H-LLZT, amounts to approximately 84% and 72%,
The cubic garnet phase can be stabilized by replacement of 3Li
crucible. In our previous work, we found that the Al partially resid-
ed in the grain boundary as a sintering aid to improve the density
of the ceramic and suppress Li loss at high temperature in garnets
pends on the content of excess lithium used to compensate lithium
loss at high temperatures (Table 1S). The compositions of LLZT with dif-
ferent amounts of excess lithium, conﬁrmed by ICP are listed in
Table S1; more Al ions are introduced into the garnet LLZT as the lithium
content increases. LLZT with good mechanical and electrical perfor-
mance can be obtained if about 20 wt.% Li
materials, and less or more lithium will increase the grain boundary

. The garnet LLZT was coated by an amorphous phase
